fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23076].

{panel:title=Request for interest|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello All,

Great to see your interest in Failover/High Availability for JIRA!

Atlassian is looking to build a solution for this to help large Enterprise customers that run JIRA in mission critical environments. At the moment we do not have any artifacts for testing but we are gathering names of interested customers. If you are one of these please, send an email to kelvin@atlassian.com with the subject: *JIRA Failover/High Availability* and I will respond accordingly.

Cheers,
Kelvin Yap
JIRA Enterprise Advocate
{panel}

\\

*Original description*
Hello,

We need to build high availability application in 24x7 mode.
We will use Oracle RDBMS with standby database and if our main server will crash, standby database will be started.

How we can make high availability for Application Tier (i.e reserved Tomcat server, etc)?

Best Regards,
Vitaly Makarychev
fields.summary: How to configure high availability application for JIRA

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

We currently override com.atlassian.jira.plugin.DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration in Studio and export the following packages to the OSGi container:

com.thoughtworks.xstream* [https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-1931]
com.ctc.wstx.stax.* [https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AGMP-46]
com.mindprod.csv* [https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AGMP-112]

It would be really nice to get rid of this override by either adding this configuration to JIRA by default or come up with an extension mechanism for the export calculation.
fields.summary: Add exports to DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23068].
  {panel}

Creating a default value for a custom field such as a select field, which can have only one value, the text reads:

"Set Custom Field Defaults

Set the custom field default values for custom field: "

"values" is confusing for users. "value" would be better, since even for multi-valued fields the choice of multiple options is really just one value.
fields.summary: Creating a default value for a custom field asks for more than one value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23067].
  {panel}

When you create a custom field, you can restrict it by Issue Type or by Project. The section that restricts by project in 4.1.2 has the text:

"Choose applicable context

Please choose the contexts where this configuration will be applicable. Note that this will apply to only issues with the selected issue type as above."

which confuses users because the only contexts shown below are in fact projects. After the default context has been defined during creation (Global, or restricted by issue type or project) then other custom field contexts can be added.

I think the word "context" should be replaced by "project" in this case.
fields.summary: Creating a custom field refers to Context instead of Project
Create Issue screen not updating resolution field when the outgoing transition is Resolved (or Closed)
Time Since Chart adds 'created DESC' even if it's already in the filter
Make AJS.IssuePicker avaliable for JIRA-Gadgets
Long custom field name overlap in JIRA 4.2
Make roadmap gadget render data even if no release dates
Make JIRA gadgets wallboard capable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23039].
  {panel}

Currently, our installation of JIRA seems to use several different date formats:

November 16 - 4:00 PM (activity view on project)
Today 4:19 PM (issue creation/updated)
16/Nov/10 4:24 PM (issue comments, etc.)
16/Nov/10 (dashboard issues)

I would love to be able to set formats in my user preferences. 

A lot of people who use my installation prefer 12 hour time, but I prefer 24 hour time. Some folks prefer "Nov 16 10", while others prefer "2010-09-16", and others prefer "16 Nov 2010". Add time into the mix and I could write examples for eternity. A few hate the relative dates (Today, tomorrow, etc) especially when they go into X minutes ago and don't update.
fields.summary: Enable users to set their own date, time, and datetime formats

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23026].
  {panel}

GreenHopper allows for multiple-line summaries (which JIRA doesn't appear to by itself) but they break email notifications, especially HTML-formatted ones. From within JIRA and GreenHopper they look fine:

!gh-edit.png!

!gh-created.png!

!jira-summary.png!

But when email notifications are sent they look like this:

!gh-notification.png!

Text-only notifications are less broken-looking, with just the extra email headers shown at the top.
fields.summary: Multiple-line issue summary created in GreenHopper breaks email notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23025].
  {panel}

The jql autocomplete parser has some weird behaviour around reserved characters see JRA-22927. Full-stops are not an uncommon things in version numbers.

Right now if one has versions 4.0, 4.0.1, 4.1 and 4.2. And types 'affectedVersion = 4.0' 4.1 and 4.2 will still be in the list but there will be an ! at the top of the jql parser box.

If you type 'affectedVersion = "4.0' (note the double-quote (") is not yet closed), the autocomplete list will be winnowed down to just 4.0 and 4.0.1 but there will be an ! at the top of the jql parser box.

If you type 'affectedVersion = ""' and then within the "" type 4.0 the list will be winnowed down to 4.0 and 4.0.1 and the jql parser will keep its tick. 

I would expect that all three would behave the same way. With perhaps the first 2 keeping the ! as the value is not quoted correctly.
fields.summary: JQL parser should handle reserved characters better and more consistently.
Implement a permission check framework for depending permissions

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform

The application of the auto-complete renderer to the fix/affected versions field and components field is a welcome addition to Jira.
What would be even more useful is if the auto-complete renderer could also be applied to any multi-select and/or multi-checkboxes custom field.
We've got one particularly large multi-checkboxes custom field that has options added to it at a rate of 1 or 2 options a week. As it stands it causes major screen real estate problems when using "simple" searching. 
The "advanced" searching JQL auto-complete actually already offers auto-complete for the field in question, but for our less advanced users, we'd love to see something closer to the components/versions/labels auto-completion style in the simple searching (and general issue editing/moving) views.
fields.summary: Allow multi-select and multi-checkboxes custom field types to use auto-complete renderer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22999].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

JIRA generates invalid XML/RSS feed output for the *Export Search as RSS* feature under certain conditions.

h3. Symptoms

Trying to consume the XML/RSS output will fail for most applications. e.g. if you try to consume this from Confluence's JIRA Issues Macro, it will not work.

h3. Details

h4. Example -- labels with double hyphen

# Have a label with a double hyphen in it, e.g. "a--a".
# Go to Labels Heatmap and click that label.
# Switch to RSS view.

Observe: incorrect XML. Google Chrome shows an error message like this:

{{error on line 7 at column 138: Comment not terminated}}

The parse error is caused by the very first comment in the generated XML. It contains an example URL, and that URL contains your label, which in turn contains two hyphens in a row, which is forbidden by the XML spec (chapter 2.5).

h4. Example -- URL contains double hyphen

If your JIRA instance URL has a double hyphen in it, e.g. {{my--site.atlassian.net}}, this will trigger the same as above.

h3. Work around

There is no work around.
fields.summary: Search for a label containing double hyphen generates bad XML in RSS view
Create indexes on startup if they are missing
Issue Types Missing from the Default Issue Type Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22974].
  {panel}

We have a number of projects with components. Since Jira does not support subcomponents, we maintain a hierarchy while creating components. For example:  A component called CompA with subcomponents will be created as 
CompA - SC1
CompA - SC2
CompA - SC3
Now, when we do a JQL Search, we want to search by specifying  Components LIKE "CompA"  which should return all issues with all components starting with CompA. Due to this missing feature, we now have to list all component names which is tedious since we sometimes have 20 subcomponents to a component.
fields.summary: Need support for LIKE operator in JQL
Autocomplete Assignees

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22970].
  {panel}

Hello,

When changing the Security Scheme of a project, while it is running, if any user tries to access any issue within this project, he gets a 'Permission Violation' error. This seems like a rather harsh way of telling the users that the security scheme of this project have changed.

Worst case scenario, with a project with thousands of issues, this process takes quite a while to complete. And, in this whole time the process is taking place, the users get a 'Permission Violation' exception, where there should be a message much like the reindex message (when a user tries to do any action while the reindexing is taking place, he doesn't get a 'ugly' message, but instead a nice "the reindexing is taking place, please wait".

Based on the ticket:

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-67441

Cheers 
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: When the security scheme of a project, permission violation is thrown without warning to users.

Hello Atlassian,

until version 4.0.2 there was an Announcement Banner *Preview* Option.
Nowadays (in 4.2) there is only "Set Banner" available.

=> Seems that these preview option got lost during code changes as I could not understand why this could have been removed on purpose.

Please fix this issue in next release. Thanks!

BR,
 Markus

PS: Having a "hidden" checkbox as suggested [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+an+Announcement+Banner?focusedCommentId=226166438#comment-226166438] would be quite useful, too.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22961].
  {panel}

When you create a custom field and give it a description, that description correctly appears under the field on all applicable screens. Editing the custom field description will work in a simple JIRA configuration (i.e. one project with one field configuration) but at some point this behaviour changed on me (I think it may have been as soon as other projects/field configurations were added). An update to the custom field description through the View Custom Field page no longer had any effect outside this page.  At this point you must edit the custom field description in all appropriate Field Configurations (System > Issue Fields > Field Configurations and open the proper field configuration)
What I find frustrating is that there is no indication of this change and I spent a lot of time trying to understand why what worked before was no longer working.

I have no issue with updating the custom field description in the appropriate Field Configurations because this provides great flexibility (although could mean a lot of work if you have a complex environment). What I am hoping you can do is something to reduce the confusion when it stops working the way it initially did.

I would suggest:
* Providing an *option* to propagate the description - allowing you to select which field configurations would be overwritten
* A warning that the change will have no effect on existing field configurations (and therefore screens).

My preference would be the first suggestion as I believe it would greatly improve the user experience.

I hope I have explained this clearly.
Regards,
Jon
fields.summary: Improve handling of custom field description updates
Expose manager necessary for custom field creation
Make JIRA Imports Faster

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22950].
  {panel}

Hello,

Currently, when you have setup JIRA Crowd integration, and when you create a user within JIRA's User Browser, it automatically gets created inside Crowd, and there is no way avoiding it. This might be useful when you want separate groups of users using JIRA, and want only one group (your employees, for instance) to count towards your crowd license and have SSO, while other users exist inside JIRA's database and can only login JIRA. (As stated in this ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-67274

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: JIRA Crowd integration users existing only inside JIRA database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22942].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. David's description here is in line with the JIRA PM team's current thinking about subtasks. We want to strike a balance between more flexible parent-child hierarchies and the reasoning in Scott's original comment that having separate issue types allows for different sets of fields in the subtask.

Nevertheless, I don't expect us to address this for quite a while. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

To create what should be a simple parent-child relationship between 2 issues in JIRA, you need to define a UNIQUE sub-issue type for every single type of child issue you might want.

So lets say I have existing issue types Dev Task, Ops Task, Future Planning, QA Task, Documentation.  And I want to create a parent Documentation issue that has sub-issues for each of my depts that will be contributing:  Dev Task, Ops Task, QA Task.  I now have to create a whole new sub-issue ("sub-task") type for each of these just so I can create a proper parent child relationship between my parent issue and sub-issues.  And for each sub-issue, I have to duplicate all my previous work on the main issue types with similar names and assign all the right field configs/screens/etc, and when searching for Eng Tasks, I now have to search for both Eng Tasks and Eng Sub-Tasks.

Lets get rid of the concept of "sub-tasks" entirely, and express parent-child relationships between issues as just that -- defining a relationship -- not entirely new issue types.
fields.summary: remove sub-tasks as a unique issue type -- sub-tasks should represent a relationship, not an issue type
Enable Searching by domain of email address, either specifically by domain, or by allowing ~ operator w/reporter field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22932].
  {panel}

Hi,

I just upgraded from JIRA 4.1.1 to 4.2.

In 4.1.1, when I clicked on the "Comment" button at the top of the window and entered a long comment, the comment window would automatically expand so that I could see a lot of the context. In 4.2, the size of the Comment window is quite small making it difficult to enter longer comments.

From http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22046, I understand that this change in behavior was intentional. However, it is not appreciated. Our users typically add long comments and it is annoying to have to scroll all the way to the bottom of the issue to get an auto-sized comment window. The is especially true in our installation, where we have the comments sorted in descending order. The newest comment is not at the bottom of the window. It is closer to the top.

In the future, can you allow the behavior of the comment window to be a user-selectable/customizable setting? Failing that, how 'bout allowing adminstratrators to set the behavior? Or, perhaps, put a buttion next to the comment window which allows the user to allow the window to expand if they so desire?
fields.summary: Resize comment window option
Users should be able to edit their own comments by default
Keyboard shortcut combination with modifier keys is not disabled when keyboard shortcuts is disabled
JIRA should detect issue URLs when pasting them in the issues field when I am trying to link an issue

Gmail uses: (create new) - lower case

I would recommend a compromise : (create label) - lower case

-Pt 2.-

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22871].
  {panel}

Here's the issue as described by Stephen:

"At the moment, thumbnails in the attachments section interact differently to thumbnails in comments. In the attachments section, when clicked JIRA pops up a full size version of the image but clicking a thumbnail in the comments prompts me to download the image. I expect them both to act in exactly the same way (the first way).
 
One more thing is that when right clicking to open an image in a new tab I am always prompted to download the image. I am unable to preview in the browser (as I was able to before 4.0)."


Is this something we can address and if so do we need to create diagrams or mock-ups to explain the solution?

My take is that the new attachments functionality has introduced some inconsistencies within the View Issue page and also with previous versions of JIRA. Ideally we need to make the behaviours consistent and have right mouse click and open in new tab working as expected.

Please come and chat if you need more info.

!viewing_attachments.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: View images using consistent and existing behaviour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22863].
  {panel}

I have a user called "fred" with the password "fred".

Whenever I try to authenticate as him using basic auth and the wrong password, the Current Failed Login Count increases by 2, not 1.

With CAPTCHA set to required after 3 failures, this means it is instead requiring CAPTCHA after 2 failures.

Before the attempt:
!1FredBeforeLogin.png!

Bad login request: (the credentials are fred:notfred)
!2FredBadLoginRequest.png!

Unauthorised response:
!3FredBadLoginResponse.png!

Value is incorrect:
!4FredIncorrectLoginCount.png!
fields.summary: Each failed login attempt via basic auth increases the failed login count by 2

Why can't I use the mouse to select an issue? 

1. The mouse hover is neither select or focus, but clearly the user was expecting it to be.  He wanted to select an issue with his mouse and hit A.

2. The behaviour of mouse & N/P in View Issue Comments is different than the behaviour of mouse & J/K in Issue Nav.  They should be the same wrt how focus is transferred from keyboard to mouse.

JT lets tighten this up.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22647].
  {panel}

JQL auto-complete for custom field with the name & not working.
1) Create a custom field with the name "&&"
2) Use the JQL autocomplete in IE 8 to select this field as a clause in a JQL query. After typing "&", the custom field appears in the dropdown, but when
selecting it, the javascript doesn't replace it properly in JQL textbox.
Screenshot:
http://img.skitch.com/20101101-kwndnt4ky1bqdubi9he81813nf.jpg

This bug was discovered by the selenium test:

TestJqlAutoCompleteManipulatesJiraData.testWithCrossSiteScriptingData
fields.summary: JQL auto-complete for custom field with the name & not working in IE 8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22640].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage. That said, there are several add-ons on the [marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/] which should solve some customers' use-cases for this suggestion.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

On the Issues Search page, there are fields for filtering by Created, Updated, Due, and Resolved dates. It would be extremely useful if I could filter by the Fix Version release date.

Each Version in a JIRA project has an optional Release Date field. If that release date is set, I'd like to be able to filter on it. So, like the Updated Date fields in Issues Search allows for explicit or relative date values, I'd like to be able to create a query based on a Fix Version's release date.

So instead of saying "Updated After" below, it would say "Fix Version Release Date After" or something.

Example:
Our developers work on multiple projects that each have their own version release dates. I would like to create a filter for my developers where it shows all issues that have a Fix Version release date between now and 1 month in the future.
fields.summary: Filter by fix version release date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22632].
  {panel}

Supports heavily relies on goodness of modz detector. However, in SAC we observe customers who for some reason modify the hash file, which prevent correct diagnose of reported problems. 

Due to misleading output of modz detector, the reported problems are misdiagnosed causing delays and customer frustrations. Also, those support requests Support needs do spend a lot of time on analysing the source code and often look for assistance from developers.

We could improve the current implementation by either:
- signing the hash file,
- downloading its hash value or even the file directly from Atlassian.
fields.summary: Modz detector should be improved to prevent 'false positive' due to customisation of the hash file

Root cause : database corruption. a user has been removed manually (or otherwise lost) from the userbase table but is still referenced in the projectroleactor table

Deleting users from JIRA, especially on the LDAP side should be handled more gracefully or a meaningful error message shown instead of the cryptic stacktrace.
fields.summary: Better handling on corrupted project role
Option to hide inactive workflows in the view workflow screen.
JIRA Index Path
Ability to easily customize the $issueTableHtml

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22600].
  {panel}

Hi,

Due to a security 'issue' JRA-21232, a major piece of functionality that is used by our company has been removed. This has been raised 'but dismissed' in JSP-66660.

Basically we have a large amount (10TB+) of attachments currently stored on an external RAID array, whilst the installation of JIRA is on a relatively small SSD in our server. The change implemented in JRA-21232 will force us (in new JIRA instances) to put all the attachments in the home directory, aka on the SSD. 

Clearly this does not suit how we use JIRA and looks like a major regression in functionality. My i recommend that for private JIRA's like ours we should be able to use the admin GUI to put attachments, log files etc on any UNC path we want.
fields.summary: Please support attachments, logs etc not in the home path of a JIRA install. (caused by JRA-21232)
SOAP RPC plugin should be upgraded to be a version 2 plugin
Update JIRA to use SAL 2.2.0
Add the ability to federate searches across multiple JIRA instances...
Add ability to check assignee availability/workload before assigning issue...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22582].
  {panel}

When validating dates JIRA rejects dates as invalid if the the date is the start date of daylight savings time daylight savings time transitions at midnight in the system's timezone.

Effected dates and timezones include the following in the year 2010:
Cannot parse "21/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Havana)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Asuncion)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Campo_Grande)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Cuiaba)
Cannot parse "10/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Santiago)
Cannot parse "10/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Antarctica/Palmer)
Cannot parse "10/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Santiago)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Argentina/Buenos_Aires)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Argentina/Cordoba)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Argentina/Tucuman)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Sao_Paulo)
Cannot parse "28/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Scoresbysund)
Cannot parse "28/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Atlantic/Azores)
Cannot parse "30/04/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Africa/Cairo)
Cannot parse "25/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Amman)
Cannot parse "28/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Beirut)
Cannot parse "02/04/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Damascus)
Cannot parse "01/04/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Gaza)
Cannot parse "30/04/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Africa/Cairo)
Cannot parse "22/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Tehran)
Cannot parse "01/04/1981": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Europe/Minsk)

This is a direct result of the date being treated as a time with the time portion being set to 00:00:00.  On the day of transition to daylight saving the times between 00:00:00 and 00:59:59 don't exist and so the date is rejected.
fields.summary: JIRA does not allow entry of dates for the Daylight Savings Transition date in timezones where the transition occurs at midnight.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22578].
  {panel}

I have configured Jira to authenticate via Crowd, which works fine by the way. But suddenly the login stopped working and the error 
"An internal server error occurred when requesting resource http://[domain].com:8080/rest/gadget/1.0/login." is instead shown in a popup. It turned out that my Crowd evaluation license had ended which caused this error. (I will by the starter license by the way. ;)

*How to reproduce:*
1) Configure Jira to authenticate via your Crowd installation.
2) Make sure Crowd has a evaluation license that has ended, and message "License Too Old For Build error" should be shown on the Crowd login page.
3) Do a login attempt and the error message above will be shown.

*Actual result:*
Error message "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource http://[domain].com:8080/rest/gadget/1.0/login." is shown in a popup. Users are unable to login when this happens.

*Suggested result:*
Display a descriptive message that clearly indicates that it is a problem with the Crowd installation. Something in the line of "Unable to authenticate via Crowd. Check your crowd installation.".
fields.summary: More userfriendly error message when unable to authenticate via Crowd

fields.description:
linkedIssues() is fine if you know what issues to check links to, but if like us, you want to be able to see any issues that have been assigned to you that are blocking someone else from completing one of their issues, then it cannot be done.

I want to be able to do something like:
(status = Open OR status = Reopened) AND assignee = currentUser() AND issue in linkedIssues((status = Open or status = Reopened) and link = blocks) ORDER BY priority DESC, created ASC

"tell me which items i have open that block other issues that are open"
fields.summary: Ability to search for all issues that are linked to (i.e. blocking) by any issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22571].
  {panel}

An invalid language preference will cause a stack trace for a user whenever
they attempt to view a profile. Initial testing shows that this error only
affects the user who inputs the invalid data.

STR
1. Visit http://localhost:8080/projects/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
2. Click the edit icon next to preferences
3. Modify the Language dropdown with burp/firebug so that the value attribute
has special characters such as ' > <
4. Save
5. You should get a stack trace after being redirected to your profile

Recommended remediation
The Language preference should only allow known Languages to be inputted. An
invalid language selection should default back to English.
fields.summary: Language preference is not validated causing exception on invalid data
Method under Administration-->Browser Users to allow options to control which domain(s) are used for authentication
JIRA Needs an Append-Only Field or Permission
Custom field names with trailing white space should get matched by the project importer
Add support for personal labels on issues
Sort comments arrow direction

fields.description: As there are two levels in the data, it should be exported as two columns in Excel. One for the "hi" part and one for the "low".
fields.summary: Cascading select attribute needs to be improved also when exporting to Excel
Printable Version Roadmap report

Could one of the developers look to see if the Pluck CSS is overriding the Delicious Byte CSS?  This is one theory as to why we are unable to edit the HTML editor the way we need to - ie formatting, including embed codes to videos, etc.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22517].
  {panel}

How to reproduce:
go to Priorities section in the Administration screen, pick any priority and try to change its attributes.
Then see if this priority is actually changed for any issue.
Nope.

It looks like the cache for priorities is not refreshed by {{com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.priorities.EditPriority}} action.

Known workaround: just reshuffle back and forth the order of priorities after editing any of them (using up and down arrows) and it will refresh the caches used by JIRA.
fields.summary: Editing priorities in admin section and saving it does not have any visible impact on priorities in the system
personal vacation planning

fields.description:

  {panel}

h4. Symptom:
If user double clicks on "Delete" button when deleting a user, the NullPointerException will be triggered by the 2nd user deleting request and thrown on UI.
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException

...
{noformat}

h4. Suggestion:
Disable(grey) "Delete" button after it's clicked.
fields.summary: Throw NullPointerException when double click "Delete" user button

Thank you,
Susan Unger
susan.unger@workday.com
fields.summary: CLONE - Request a monitor
Projects should be grouped by category

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22508].
  {panel}

Logging in flat files is great for standard configurations.

However, when deploying JIRA in large organizations, it's annoying to have a lot of log files to monitor, rotate and backup. Especially when you already have some standard log management processes.

We centralize all logs using the syslog protocol. But in order to send JIRA logs to a syslog server, you currently have to modify a lot of files.
And I let JIRA developpers imagine the mess admins have to deal with when upgrading JIRA... Especially when the logging configuration is updated between releases. ;)

So, when will the admins get a convenient logging feature?
fields.summary: Easier syslog integration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22506].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Currently you can look for an issue that has been updated in the last 5 days. It would be useful to tie this in with the working days set in Time Tracking to search for issues created in the last 5 working days.
fields.summary: JQL search with working days range

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22499].
  {panel}

The "principle of least astonishment" http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principle_of_least_astonishment was violated when I decided to delete an issue link.  

To edit a link?  Why you simply click "view links in more detail".  View != Edit is the violation.

How hard would it be to use Alt Text that goes "edit links or view links in more detail"?

Thanks
fields.summary: Only Way To Delete an Issue Link is to Click Something That Says "View" on it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22487].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As a user I would like to be able to search and return sub-tasks in the results where the parent issue meets certain criteria. For example:

{code}
parent = CRM-46 AND parent.assignee = mminicki
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a JQL function (and API) allowing to search for issues where the sub-task meets certain criteria.
 
h3. Workaround 

There are two current third-party plugins that provide this functionality:

* [Script Runner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/server/overview], the [subtasksOf()|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/jql-functions.html#_subtasksof] function.
* [J-Tricks|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.j-tricks.jql-plugin/server/overview], the [subtask|http://www.j-tricks.com/jqlt-subtask-functions.html] functions.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to search for sub-tasks with parent related conditions
"Move" doesn't make sense as UI action to _convert_ issue types
Test New Project Create
